page.title: 03ASHDOWN FOREST ECOLOGY (2)
page.content: Scientific Interest and to promote a caring attitude and interest in wild- life through education. Access to the Nature Reserve is restricted to marked paths. Rarities in every category of wild-life are recorded but their habi- tats are never divulged. There are firebreaks on both the forest and the Nature Reserve and recovery after the 1984 fires is being monitored monthly in the Reserve by a local school. Wood cut here is often piled up to create a habitat site, rather than being burned. Certain birds and butterflies, now rare in the Forest are being bred locally and reinstated. Guided natural history walks are organised by the Forest Rangers. Participants pay a small fee.
